data.text: Why is Red Square called so? In old Russian “krasnaya” (meaning “red” nowadays) was the word for "beautiful”. Come to see that the iconic square lives up to its name in all senses. #Aeroflot #RussiaTravel #FunnyFact https://t.co/btM6dlXvxs

On 11 November, we celebrate the birthday of Fyodor Dostoevsky, one of the world’s most famous writers and the pillar of Russian literature📖 One of our A320s has been named after Fyodor Dostoevsky. #Aeroflot #AircraftNames #GreatNames https://t.co/nj5EbqRHbL

data.text: Did you know that the control tower’s windows giving 360-degree field of vision are generally tilted outwards at a 15-degree angle to eliminate reflection of controllers' equipment and cut out glare, while ceilings are often painted black #Aeroflot #NewCalendarPage https://t.co/enmMJbqC6q
This is how it happened. Play basketball. Fly Aeroflot. @kobebryant https://t.co/6laoERTNE2

data.text: Аeroflot launches winter schedule from 27 October https://t.co/XvFdClHGas https://t.co/hYg8iYpyWB

Do you know why so many flight attendant uniforms include a neck scarf? It’s a matter of tradition that stemmed from the early aviators wearing silk scarves because they prevented chafing around the neck. Now the scarf is there for beauty. #Aeroflot #Professionals https://t.co/xiCX3Hh2T0

data.text:
On 12 October 1956 the first passenger flight by Tu-104 started on the international Moscow - Prague route. The Tu-104 was a pioneer of commercial jet aviation and one of the first jet airliners in the world.
#Aeroflot #History https://t.co/jww87ioEmu

data.text: We’ve won at the Business Traveller Awards 2019 in London! Voted Best Eastern European Airline again by readers of UK’s leading magazine Business Traveller. https://t.co/CAyB0QXubI  #Aeroflot #BusinessTravellerAwards2019 https://t.co/qtn196J6MR

Did you know that Baikal is the biggest and deepest freshwater lake on Earth? This mountain lake was formed about 30 million years ago making it also the oldest in the world. Aeroflot flies the 6 hour Moscow - Irkutsk route 4 times daily. #Aeroflot #ExploreRussia https://t.co/EdLBSopg6M

Vacations say a lot about people. It is believed that an introvert is more likely to choose to travel to the mountains, while an extrovert is more likely to opt for the beach. Do you agree? What kind of vacations do you prefer? #Aeroflot #Travel #FunnyFact https://t.co/0tYnzjOkBX

data.text: To make sure you pass security checks quickly, pack your carry-on bags cleverly! Here are our tips for hand luggage packing. #Aeroflot #Tips #Infographics #HandBaggage https://t.co/XHfZMYW8zp

The load on the turbine blade inside a modern jet engine is equivalent to the weight of a crowded London double-decker. That is why the turbine parts are made of titanium alloys. #Aeroflot #NewCalendarPage https://t.co/yww5bzlCga
We’ve begun selling tickets for flights to Mumbai! Daily services to the gateway to India launch next July. Details: https://t.co/FcUgeJMQoA  #Aeroflot #Mumbai https://t.co/SVNsQZhNix

Kazan is called Russia's third capital. A diverse modern city with a 1,000-year-long history. Discover it with Aeroflot! Learn more: https://t.co/fHdHfe3ZvP
#Aeroflot #ExploreRussia #Kazan https://t.co/gIRxRl5E2S

Did you know that the Krasnoyarsk National Nature Reserve Stolby is one of the most visited places in Russia? Its highlights are, of course, the fingers of the volcanic mountain, called “Stolby”. Aeroflot can bring you there! Explore Russia with us! https://t.co/gFPaaH43Cz https://t.co/MgpWjBENGo

data.text:
It is our September #NewCalendarPage! Do you know that aircraft have a
reverse thrust? However, most civil airplanes are still moved by special pushback
tugs because using a reverse thrust costs extra fuel, and the view from the
cockpit is limited. https://t.co/B7cE4MK62t
Information for passengers flying from Paris on 12 – 14 September 2019 https://t.co/PiYtyKKmZR

Today is the 191st birthday of the great Russian writer Leo Tolstoy, whose name has been given to one of our Airbus A320 aircraft. His “War and Peace” and “Anna Karenina” are acknowledged to be among the best novels of all times. #Aeroflot #GreatNames #LeoTolstoy https://t.co/uLju7cJBZj

data.text:
Do you know that the French Republic covers more time zones than any
country on the planet? It has 12 time zones! Mainland France spans just one. The remaining are added through French Overseas Dependencies. Discover the world with us! #Aeroflot #FunnyTravelFact https://t.co/pQPAjzleRR

RT @FIBAWC: Poster alert‼️ 🤳📸

@MEasy_50 from @nbbfonline 🇳🇬 posterizes Jeong Hyogeun for one of the best #FIBAWC Aeroflot Airlines Best Fl…

With Aeroflot’s Charity programme “Mercy Miles” you can donate your miles to help children! Your miles become award tickets for kids needing special medical treatment, or young musical talents. #Aeroflot #MakingTheWorldBetter #InternationalDayOfCharity https://t.co/kaF521fw4J

It’s time to celebrate the beauty of autumn! Do it with Aeroflot! 
Photo: Tsarskoe Selo park ensemble, St. Petersburg suburb https://t.co/trmeXxuHv2

On 11 August 1959 Sheremetyevo airport was opened in Moscow. This year, it was named after the great Russian poet Alexander Pushkin. Sheremetyevo Pushkin airport is Aeroflot’s base. Congratulations! https://t.co/k7J684zB2a

annotations.normalized_text: FIBA Basketball World Cup 2019 Trophy Tour

data.text: FIBA Basketball World Cup 2019 Trophy Tour, presented by Aeroflot, is about to reach Moscow! On August 1, not only can you see the Trophy, but also make a fantastic selfie with it in Zaryadye Park! #Aeroflot #FIBAWC #WorldGotGame #BestFlyingMoments #FIBATrophyTour https://t.co/ikFbarq2a6

data.text: “The desire to fly is an idea handed down to us by our ancestors who... looked enviously on the birds soaring freely through space... on the infinite highway of the air.” ― Wilbur Wright, an American aviation pioneer. https://t.co/l4UtlvLKZR
For International Transit Passengers. https://t.co/ISPuYc5C3t

What a marvellous view opens from the 439-metre-long SkyBridge. 207
metres above the Krasnaya Polyana valley, it forms part of the Sochi SkyPark. #Aeroflot_ExploreRussia https://t.co/m93I5FBKJo

Aeroflot has improved its position among the world's top 20 airlines by passenger traffic! The Leading Airline Groups by Airline Business ranks us 18th, which is two places up versus last year's result.
#Aeroflot #AirlineBusiness #LeadingAirlineGroups https://t.co/LvCmpnsTkQ

data.text:
These are some cities where Aeroflot goes. On the basis of the skyline, guess which of these is: Paris, Cairo, Moscow, Milan or London.
#AeroflotCityQuiz https://t.co/mg7p5Lrfrz

Could you imagine that at any given time, there are 9,700 planes and 1.2 million people in the sky? That would make the skies the 156th most populous country in the world, right between Estonia and East Timor.
#Aeroflot #FunnyFact https://t.co/NkYqUe1NVL
